newsitem.title: GERMANY: Deutsche cuts SAP to neutral.
newsitem.headline: Deutsche cuts SAP to neutral.

text.p: Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, the research arm of Germany's Deutsche Bank AG, said on Wednesday it had cut its recommendation for business software group SAP AG to "neutral" from "overweight."
SAP had issued an unexpected profit warning on Tuesday evening, revising its 1996 revenue forecast to 3.5 billion marks from 3.8 billion marks.
Deutsche MG analyst Juergen Hackenberg told Reuters he had also cut his earning per share estimates for SAP for this year and next.
Hackenberg has reduced the EPS estimates, according to the DVFA analysis method, to 5.20 marks for 1996 and 7.20 marks for 1997 from 5.75 marks and 7.60 marks respectively.
SAP preferred shares are listed on the DAX blue chip index and are more actively traded than its ordinary shares.
